docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

docs.lead_paragraph: At times, President Obama’s rhetoric has shifted, but the record indicates there is an underlying constancy in his stated goals amid profound events.

docs.lead_paragraph: BALLARD--Claude M.,Jr., born September 27, 1929, passed away peacefully at his home on Thursday, February 11, 2010 in Little Rock, Arkansas. He was surrounded by family and friends. Claude Ballard was a General Partner of Goldman, Sachs & Co in New York from 1981 to 1988 at which time he became a Limited Partner. Prior to that, he was a Senior Vice President with the Prudential Insurance Company. He had been a Director on a number of public, private and not-for profit enterprises, including CBL and Associates, Rockefeller Center Properties (Chairman of the Board), The Urban Land Institute (President), Wells Fargo Trust Co., Taubman Centers, Inc., Mutual Life Insurance Company of New York, St. Vincent Health Care System (Little Rock, AR), Quapaw Area Council Boy Scouts of America, Greater New York Council Boy Scouts of America, and others. He was Emeritus member of New York University's Real Estate Institute and former chairman of its Real Estate Finance Advisory Council. He was a former member of the Overseer's Visiting Committee for the Graduate School of Design at Harvard as well as Chairman Emeritus and member of the Advisory Board of the Wharton School Department of Real Estate at the University of Pennsylvania. He was a member of the Policy Advisory Board of the Business School at the University of Wisconsin. He enjoyed lecturing on real estate development at Wharton, Harvard, Cornell, Stanford, Southern Methodist University, Michigan State, University of Wisconsin, and NYU, and was designated a Distinguished Fellow by the National Society for Real Estate Finance and is Fellow of The Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (United Kingdom). He is survived by his wife, Mary Birnbach Ballard, their three daughters -- Karen Hart, Melinda Ballard and Robyn Ziperski -- two sons-in-law -- Alan Hart and Jim Ziperski -- and six grandchildren -- Stephanie and Michael Hart, Reese Allison, Andrew, Laura and Claire Ziperski -- a sister and brother-in-law, Nancy and Mel Woolsey and their five children. He will be dearly missed by his family, friends and colleagues.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BALLARD, CLAUDE M.
